column4: howdy. I'm having a problem listening to my music cd's on ubuntu.
I know its not the speakers, i can hear sound when I play sounds that are locally on the hard drive.
what application are you using to play CDs?
when i try to open up the cd in nautilus, i receive this error message:
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hdd,
or too many mounted file systems
more than likely it's a volume slider that needs to be unmuted
i have no probs with data cd's on the cd dirve.
In the Volume Control, are you using the ALSA mixer or the OSS mixer?
sorry, but how would i find that out.
and both the OSS mixer and the alsa mixer is there.
